invention.title: invention
invention.description: the act of creating something new, or the thing that has been created.
invention.Image Description: A bright lightbulb appearing above a creative mind, symbolizing a new idea or product coming into existence.
invention.example: Have you heard the story that Marco Polo brought noodles back to Italy, leading to the invention of pasta?

unspecified.title: unspecified
unspecified.description: not stated clearly or exactly; not known or mentioned.
unspecified.Image Description: A blurry calendar or a clock with no hands, suggesting an unknown or vague moment in time.
unspecified.example: Here, the phrase at one point or another means at some unspecified time in the past.

idiom.title: idiom
idiom.description: a group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words.
idiom.Image Description: A speech bubble containing a confusing image (like raining cats and dogs) that conveys a figurative meaning, not literal.
idiom.example: And finally, the idiom to push the boundaries means to do things which challenge normal acceptable behaviour.

boundaries.title: boundaries
boundaries.description: a line that marks the limits of an area; often used figuratively to refer to the limits of what is considered normal or acceptable.
boundaries.Image Description: A clear line on the ground being stepped over, or a fence being pushed through, symbolizing the breaking of limits.
boundaries.example: If you push the boundaries, you act in a way which challenges normal acceptable behaviour.

acceptable.title: acceptable
acceptable.description: able to be agreed on; suitable or pleasing, especially to a particular group.
acceptable.Image Description: A hand giving a thumbs-up gesture, or a person nodding in approval, indicating something is within limits or agreeable.
acceptable.example: If you push the boundaries, you act in a way which challenges normal acceptable behaviour.

fresh.title: fresh
fresh.description: (of food) newly made or gathered; not preserved by canning, freezing, etc.
fresh.Image Description: A close-up of vibrant, dewy vegetables just picked, or dough being kneaded with flour, emphasizing newness and natural state.
fresh.example: Well, some people buy them dried in a packet, others make them fresh from wheat or rice, but there is little doubt that noodles are popular around the world.

popular.title: popular
popular.description: liked, enjoyed, or admired by many people.
popular.Image Description: A large crowd of diverse people smiling and engaged, or a product with many hands reaching for it, indicating wide appeal.
popular.example: Well, some people buy them dried in a packet, others make them fresh from wheat or rice, but there is little doubt that noodles are popular around the world.

origins.title: origins
origins.description: the point or place where something begins, arises, or is derived.
origins.Image Description: A map with a starting point highlighted, or the intricate root system of a large tree, showing the beginning of something.
origins.example: From their origins, probably somewhere in China, noodle recipes were spread by traders on the ancient Silk Road.

recipes.title: recipes
recipes.description: a set of instructions for preparing a particular dish, including a list of the ingredients required.
recipes.Image Description: An open cookbook with handwritten notes and illustrations, or a chef carefully following steps with ingredients laid out.
recipes.example: From their origins, probably somewhere in China, noodle recipes were spread by traders on the ancient Silk Road.

spread.title: spread
spread.description: to extend over a large or increasing area; to distribute over an area.
spread.Image Description: Ripples expanding across a pond, or a map with dotted lines extending from a central point, illustrating diffusion.
spread.example: From their origins, probably somewhere in China, noodle recipes were spread by traders on the ancient Silk Road.

traders.title: traders
traders.description: people who buy and sell goods.
traders.Image Description: A bustling ancient marketplace with merchants haggling over goods, or a caravan traversing a desert trade route.
traders.example: From their origins, probably somewhere in China, noodle recipes were spread by traders on the ancient Silk Road.

destination.title: destination
destination.description: the place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
destination.Image Description: A signpost with multiple arrows pointing to different cities, or a train arriving at a station platform, signifying an end point.
destination.example: At each destination along the road, people gave noodles a twist, adding different flavours and ingredients to create a new dish.

flavour.title: flavour
flavour.description: the distinctive taste of a food or drink.
flavour.Image Description: A close-up of steam rising from a fragrant bowl of food, or a tongue with activated taste buds, representing the sensory experience of taste.
flavour.example: At each destination along the road, people gave noodles a twist, adding different flavours and ingredients to create a new dish.

ingredients.title: ingredients
ingredients.description: any of the foods or substances that are combined to make a particular dish.
ingredients.Image Description: Assorted fresh vegetables, herbs, and spices neatly arranged in bowls on a kitchen counter, ready for cooking.
ingredients.example: At each destination along the road, people gave noodles a twist, adding different flavours and ingredients to create a new dish.

varieties.title: varieties
varieties.description: a number or collection of different kinds of something; different types.
varieties.Image Description: A diverse array of different colored and shaped noodles, or a spectrum of similar objects showing distinct variations.
varieties.example: In this programme, we'll visit the United States and Japan, two countries which have taken noodles and created exciting new varieties.

investigated.title: investigated
investigated.description: to carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts of (an incident, allegation, etc.) so as to establish the truth.
investigated.Image Description: A detective holding a magnifying glass over scattered clues, or a researcher poring over documents in a library, symbolizing diligent inquiry.
investigated.example: BBC World Service programme, The Food Chain, investigated how noodles spread from Asia through Europe to America.

uncovered.title: uncovered
uncovered.description: to discover something previously secret or unknown.
uncovered.Image Description: Hands pulling back a curtain or lid to reveal a surprising truth or hidden object underneath.
uncovered.example: They uncovered a surprising story: that pasta comes from noodles brought back to Italy by Marco Polo in the 13th century.

exotic.title: exotic
exotic.description: unusual and exciting because of coming from far away.
exotic.Image Description: A vibrant, unusually colored bird perched on a branch in a lush, faraway jungle, or a mysterious, foreign artifact glowing with intrigue.
exotic.example: So, noodles were very exotic in the 1920s and 30s in the United States, and there was a new pasta association in America that wanted to promote the manufacturing of dried pasta.

association.title: association
association.description: an organization of people with a common interest or purpose.
association.Image Description: A group of diverse individuals gathered in a meeting room, united by a common logo or emblem, symbolizing a collective body.
association.example: So, noodles were very exotic in the 1920s and 30s in the United States, and there was a new pasta association in America that wanted to promote the manufacturing of dried pasta.

promote.title: promote
promote.description: to support or actively encourage (a cause, venture, etc.); to further the progress of something.
promote.Image Description: A person holding a megaphone or a spotlight shining on a product, emphasizing publicity and active encouragement.
promote.example: So, noodles were very exotic in the 1920s and 30s in the United States, and there was a new pasta association in America that wanted to promote the manufacturing of dried pasta.

manufacturing.title: manufacturing
manufacturing.description: the making of articles on a large scale using machinery; the act of producing goods.
manufacturing.Image Description: An assembly line with automated robotic arms constructing products, or a busy factory floor with machinery in operation, illustrating industrial production.
manufacturing.example: So, noodles were very exotic in the 1920s and 30s in the United States, and there was a new pasta association in America that wanted to promote the manufacturing of dried pasta.

meaning.title: meaning
meaning.description: used to indicate the significance of what is being said.
meaning.Image Description: A speech bubble pointing from a complex word to a simpler, clarifying phrase, showing an explanation or definition.
meaning.example: In the 1920s, noodles were popular because they were exotic, meaning foreign, unusual and exciting.

foreign.title: foreign
foreign.description: of, from, in, or characteristic of a country or language other than one's own.
foreign.Image Description: A collection of international flags, or a passport with stamps from various countries, representing different nationalities and cultures.
foreign.example: In the 1920s, noodles were popular because they were exotic, meaning foreign, unusual and exciting.

localise.title: localise
localise.description: to adapt (something) for use in a particular place or country.
localise.Image Description: A world map with a magnifying glass zooming in on a specific region, or a dish being garnished with local ingredients, illustrating adaptation to a new context.
localise.example: And at one point or another, different chefs decided to localise these dishes.

slices.title: slices
slices.description: a thin, broad piece of food or other material cut from a larger portion.
slices.Image Description: Evenly cut, thin pieces of bread or meat neatly arranged on a cutting board, highlighting uniformity and precision in cutting.
slices.example: By making these tweaks, adding new toppings and slices of beef or chicken, Japanese chefs created the noodle dish we know today as ramen.

gradually.title: gradually
gradually.description: in a slow, steady way; by degrees.
gradually.Image Description: A plant slowly unfurling new leaves over time, or a series of steps leading upwards, suggesting a gentle, incremental progression.
gradually.example: Frank thinks that Japanese ramen continues to evolve – to develop and change gradually in response to new developments and ideas.

response.title: response
response.description: a verbal or written answer; a reaction to something.
response.Image Description: Ripples spreading outwards in water from a dropped stone, or a person reacting visibly to a piece of news, depicting a consequence or reply.
response.example: Frank thinks that Japanese ramen continues to evolve – to develop and change gradually in response to new developments and ideas.

traditional.title: traditional
traditional.description: existing in or as part of a tradition; handed down from generation to generation.
traditional.Image Description: An antique scroll or a classic, timeless architectural structure, symbolizing enduring customs and heritage passed down through time.
traditional.example: Unlike other traditional food such as sushi, modern versions of ramen push the boundaries.
